intro: [WRONG START] Delphinium grandiflorum var. mosoyense, commonly known as the Siberian larkspur, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features tall, slender stems that can reach up to 1.5 meters in height, adorned with clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant has lance-shaped, serrated leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are typically arranged in dense spikes, with each bloom consisting of five petals and a distinctive spurred structure. This variety is known for its hardiness and ability to thrive in cooler climates, making it a popular choice for alpine gardens.
